params.name: revision
params.doc:
Revision number.

Include the existing `revision` to prevent conflicting updates to reservations.

docs.summary: Creates a new reservation with the `HELD` status.
description:
Reservations with the `HELD` status are only valid for 10 minutes. Trying to change a `HELD` reservation’s status after 10 minutes returns an error.

You cannot call [`Update Reservation`](#update-reservation) to change a reservation’s status from `HELD`. Trying to do so will return an error.

docs.summary:
Creates a new reservation.
`Create Reservation` creates a reservation with the status of your choice. Generally, a reservation should be created with either the `RESERVED` status or the `REQUESTED` status if manual approval is required for confirmation.
`Create Reservation` gives you the option to override the restaurant’s rules regarding online availability (using `ignoreReservationLocationConflicts`) and table management (using `ignoreTableCombinationConflicts`.)
Deletes a reservation. Only reservations in status HELD can be deleted.
Retrieves a list of up to 100 reservations.
description: This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of up to 100 reservations, given the provided filters, sorting, and paging.
description: This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

params.name: revision
params.doc:
Revision number.

Include the existing `revision` to prevent conflicting updates to reservations.

description: `Reserve Reservation` changes a reservation's `HELD` status to `RESERVED`, or to `REQUESTED` if the reservation's reservation location requires manual approval.

docs.summary: Each time the reservation is updated, revision increments by 1. The existing revision must be included when updating the reservation. This ensures you're working with the latest reservation information, and it prevents unintended overwrites.
description: This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: updateReservation example
body: const result = await reservations.updateReservation(id, reservation, options);

members.name: ignoreReservationLocationConflicts
members.doc: Ignore reservation location conflicts. This will ensure that the reservation is created even if the required seats or tables are unavailable according to the reservation location's business schedule or its pacing settings.

members.name: ignoreTableCombinationConflicts
members.doc: Ignore table combination conflicts. This will ensure that the reservation is created even if the required tables are already reserved.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: reservationId
members.doc: Reservation ID.

members.name: endDate
members.doc: End date and time of the reservation.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Party size.

members.name: reservationLocationId
members.doc: ID of the reservation location at which this reservation will be made.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Start date and time of the reservation.

members.name: tableIds
members.doc: Table IDs of tables used for this reservation.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields to be returned.

Supported values: `PUBLIC`, `FULL`.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields to be returned.

Supported values: `PUBLIC`, `FULL`.

members.name: declineReason
members.doc: The reason the reservation was declined.

members.name: details
members.doc: Reservation details.

members.name: reservedBy
members.doc: Information about the person making the reservation.

members.name: reservee
members.doc: Information about the person the reservation is being made for.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the reservation is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the current revision must be passed when updating the reservation.

Ignored when creating a reservation.

members.name: source
members.doc:
Reservation source.

This indicates how the reservation was made.
`ONLINE` indicates that the customer made the reservation through a website or app.
`OFFLINE` indicates that the reservation was made by a restaurant employee, for example when a customer calls to make a reservation.
`WALK-IN` indicates that the customer did not make a reservation beforehand, and the reservation was entered into the system by a restaurant employee when the customer arrived at the restaurant.

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the reservation. See the [Reservation Lifecycle article]() for more details on each of the statuses, and an explanations of the reservation lifecycle.

members.name: teamMessage
members.doc:
Team message.

A message for the restaurant staff containing any additional information regarding the reservation, such as special requirements for the guests.

members.doc:
Custom fields for the reservee in key-value pairs.

The key is the custom field's ID, and the value is the custom field's value.

Empty fields are not returned.
